thread.title: Thursday's field hockey roundup: Gormley breaks Gettysburg's single season scoring record

author: GameTimePA.com
title: Thursday's field hockey roundup: Gormley breaks Gettysburg's single season scoring record
text:
— 13 
First half — 1. Get, Katelyn Gormley (Madi Hirneisen), 29:06. 2. Get, Gormley (Grace Kresky), 24:45. 3. Get, Gormley (Hirneisen), 23:04. 4. Get, Gormley (Hirneisen), 20:28. 5. Get, Gormley (Hirneisen), 18:17. 6. Get, Gormley (Kresky), 17:10. 7. Elena Montenegro (Kailey Mixell), 11:40. 8. Get, Kresky (Olivia Young), 5:43. 9. Get, Montenegro (Haley Spangler), 2:51. 
Second half — 10. Get, Megan Miller, 28:33. 11. Get, Young (Gormley), 19:23. 12. Get, Gormley (Hirneisen), 12:46. 13. Get, Mixell, 3:14. Advertisement 
Shots on goal — Big 0, Get 46. 
Corners — Big 2, Get 13. 
Goalies — Big, Sierra Frock (27 saves). Get, Neemeyer (0 saves). 
KENNARD-DALE 2, HANOVER 0 >> The Rams entered the day 24th in the District 3 Class AA power rankings — the top 20 teams earn berths — they helped their postseason cause with a shutout victory vs. the Hawkettes. Callie Swegan and Morgan Bowlings each found the back of the net as the visitors out-shot the hosts, 30-2. Kennard-Dale
